categories.name: Artistic Inspirations: Famous Works and Their Muses

questions.clue: This painting by Leonardo da Vinci features a woman believed to be Lisa Gherardini, the wife of a Florentine merchant.
John Everett Millais painted this tragic Shakespearean character, inspired by his muse and model Elizabeth Siddal.
This famous American painter was inspired by his sister Nan for the iconic 1930 painting 'American Gothic'.
In 'The Birth of Venus', this Renaissance artist was inspired by Simonetta Vespucci, a celebrated beauty of Florence.
Gustav Klimt's 'The Kiss' is said to feature his longtime companion and muse, who was also a fashion designer.

categories.name: Cryptic Languages: Decoding the World's Writing Systems

questions.clue: This ancient Egyptian script was used for religious texts on papyrus and wood.
This writing system, used by the Maya civilization, is made up of logograms and syllabic symbols.
Known as Linear B, this script was used for writing Mycenaean Greek and deciphered in the 20th century.
This ancient script of Mesopotamia was written on clay tablets using a stylus.
This undeciphered script is found on the seals of the ancient civilization of the Indus Valley.

categories.name: Culinary Capitals: Dishes from Around the Globe

questions.clue: This Italian city is famous for its pizza Margherita, which includes tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
Sushi, a dish of vinegared rice and seafood, is a culinary staple of this Japanese capital.
Known for its rich culinary heritage, this French city is famous for its beef stew called Boeuf Bourguignon.
Pho, a fragrant noodle soup, is synonymous with this Vietnamese capital city.
This Peruvian capital city is renowned for its ceviche, a dish made from fresh raw fish cured in citrus juices.

categories.name: Historical Figures in Literature: Real People in Fiction

questions.clue: This Italian poet and scholar appears as a guide in Dante's 'Divine Comedy'.
In Alexandre Dumas' novel, this French King's guard captain is a prominent character.
This English king is the protagonist in William Shakespeare's play 'Richard III'.
In 'The Other Boleyn Girl' by Philippa Gregory, this queen is the second wife of Henry VIII.
This French military leader is the title character of a play by George Bernard Shaw.

categories.name: Tech Triumphs: Innovations That Changed the World

questions.clue: In 1876, Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful call on this revolutionary device.
Invented in 1973, this portable communication device by Motorola was the first of its kind.
Developed by Tim Berners-Lee in 1989, this system revolutionized how information is accessed and shared on the Internet.
Released in 2007, this Apple product changed the smartphone industry with its touch screen technology.
This 1993 release by Mosaic Communications Corporation is considered the first widely used web browser.

final.clue: This artist, whose name means 'Little Barrel', painted 'The Birth of Venus' and 'Primavera', both housed in Florence's Uffizi Gallery.
